DataElement.preferredName: Chest Pelvis Abdominal Computed Tomography Evaluation Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to evaluation based on a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis of the chest, abdomen and pelvis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chest Pelvis Abdominal Computed Tomography Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to evaluation based on a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis of the chest, abdomen and pelvis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.:The structure of the vertebrate skeleton supporting the lower limbs in humans and the hind limbs or corresponding parts in other vertebrates.:Of, or related to, the abdomen.:A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.
The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.
Of, or related to, the abdomen.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.

Concepts.definition: Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF TEXT1
ReferenceDocuments.description: CT scan of the chest,abdomen and pelvis with radionuclide bone scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Clinical grade CT scan of the chest ,abdomen, and pelvis with radionuclide bone scan OR whole body PET/CT within 30 days prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Clinical grade CT scan of the chest ,abdomen, and pelvis with radionuclide bone scan OR whole body PET/CT within 60 days prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text_5
ReferenceDocuments.description: CT scan chest/abdomen/pelvis with multiphasic liver CT scan or CT chest without  contrast and MRI of abdomen within 30 days prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: CT scan chest/abdomen/pelvis with multiphasic liver CT scan or CT of chest without contrast and MRI of abdomen and pelvis if contrast contraindicated within 30 days prior to study entry.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_5
ReferenceDocuments.description: CT scan with IV contrast (chest/abdomen/pelvis) with or without PET scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a CT scan chest/abdomen/pelvis with multiphasic liver CT scan prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Chest: CT scan (preferred); chest x-ray PA and lateral (acceptable); or PET scan (acceptable)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRG Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was Whole Body FDG PET/CT +/- contrast or CT Chest/Abdomen(and pelvis if clinically indicated) with contrast(unless contraindicated) performed?

DataElement.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-2 2018320v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
